query: What is todays news on healthcare in the US?

articles.title: The Real-Life Dating Boot Camp That Inspired ‘Love on the Spectrum’
articles.description: When U.C.L.A. psychologists first proposed teaching adults with autism how to date, funders wouldn’t go near it. Now we are in a new world.

articles.title: Democrats Grill N.I.H. Leader on Cuts: Who Is Calling the Shots?
articles.description: Senators criticized the head of the National Institutes of Health for not taking responsibility for Trump administration cuts to research funding.

articles.title: A Killer Within Easy Reach
articles.description: Pesticides are a leading means of suicide. The tiny nation of Suriname is working to restrict access to one of the most common and dangerous ones.

articles.title: F.D.A. to Use A.I. in Drug Approvals to ‘Radically Increase Efficiency’
articles.description: With a Trump-driven reduction of nearly 2,000 employees, agency officials view artificial intelligence as a way to speed drugs to the market.

articles.title: RFK Jr. Announces Eight New Members of CDC Vaccine Advisory Panel
articles.description: The health secretary promised not to pick “anti-vaxxers.” But some public health leaders accused him of breaking his word.

articles.title: Trump Bill’s Caps on Grad School Loans Could Worsen Doctor Shortage
articles.description: The proposed limits on federal loans fall well below the costs of medical school. Critics say this could deter students from pursuing medicine.

articles.title: A Day With One Abortion Pill Prescriber
articles.description: A nurse practitioner spoke on the phone with patients in states with abortion bans, assessed their medical eligibility and sent pills. She took some unconventional steps to protect their privacy.

articles.title: Gun Deaths of Children Rose in States That Loosened Gun Laws, Study Finds
articles.description: Researchers looked at firearm fatalities in the 13 years immediately after the Supreme Court limited local governments’ ability to restrict gun ownership.

articles.title: Each Person Has a Unique ‘Breath Print,’ Scientists Find
articles.description: Every breath you take, they really may be watching you.

articles.title: Reagan Invoked the ‘Welfare Queen.’ The New G.O.P. Target Is a Lazy Gamer.
articles.description: Republicans targeting safety net programs once invoked women they claimed were living lavishly on government funds. Now as they seek to pare back Medicaid, the imagery has changed — but not the argument.

articles.title: Hospital backlog drops to lowest level in two years
articles.description: But the NHS in England is still well below its target for seeing patients within 18 weeks.

articles.title: MPs set to vote on decriminalising abortion in England and Wales
articles.description: Women would never be prosecuted for terminating a pregnancy under proposed new laws.

articles.title: We quit our jobs, sold our home twice and spent 10 years fighting for the truth
articles.description: A NHS trust and hospital manager have been found guilty of health and safety failings over the death of Alice Figueiredo.

articles.title: Cervical screening invites to change in England
articles.description: Invitations be sent out by the NHS every five years instead of every three for women aged 25-49 in England, if they have a negative test.

articles.title: Martha doctor's failings 'particularly grave'
articles.description: A medical tribunal has found a senior doctor's failings amounted to gross negligence and misconduct.

articles.title: RFK Jr sacks entire US vaccine committee
articles.description: The US health secretary, a vaccine sceptic who has been criticised by health experts, said the panel was 'plagued' with conflicts of interest.

articles.title: Doctors trialling 'poo pills' to flush out dangerous superbugs
articles.description: Can a dose of good bacteria clear superbugs from their hiding place in the bowels?

articles.title: Why food firms are scrambling to cut down on ingredients
articles.description: Food firms are marketing ranges with fewer ingredients, but are they healthier?

articles.title: Exercise improves colon cancer survival, major study shows
articles.description: Risk of dying was cut by a third after colon cancer patients dialled up exercise levels.

articles.title: Disposable vape ban begins - but will it have an impact?
articles.description: Retailers will no longer be able to sell single-use vapes as new laws come into force across the UK.
